intro: Podanthum psilostachyum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved podanthum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Podostomataceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as along streams and in wetlands. Its root system is specialized for anchoring in rocky or submerged substrates. Podanthum psilostachyum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small organisms.
